overview_of_class:
Professional Linkage, POLI SCI 394-0 Spring 2017 Carol Moseley Braun "A Brief History of US Government"

This seminar on American government will focus on the shifting power arrangements between the executive, legislative and judicial branches, the impact of slavery on the structure of the US Constitution, and the continuing saga of efforts to reconcile the philosophical underpinnings of democratic government with a structure required to be flexible and resilient in the light of changing times. The course will address not only constitutional law issues, but also the role of civil society in policy making and the influence race and gender have had and continue to have on outcomes. Invited guests will include policy makers from all levels and arenas of government, including diplomats, judges, bureaucrats, executives and legislators.
